shorts.title: Artist Janet Pierce: ‘We arrived into Northern Ireland at the height of the Troubles, was forced to confront some of life’s darkest realities’

shorts.title: Keystone UNICO donates and volunteers at St. Francis Kitchen
shorts.title_distilled: Keystone UNICO donates and volunteers at St.
shorts.description: The Keystone Chapter UNICO donated and volunteered at St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen in Scranton for their April Service Day. After instructions and prepping for the dinner, they had the opportunity to serve the clients of St. Francis Kitchen. Keystone UNICO volunteers pictured with St. Francis Kitchen’s executive chef, Selena Gonzalez, are Tina Haas, director; Michele McDade, president; Gonzalez; and Cathy Gerard, secretary. Kitchen donations are accepted. Checks should be made payable to and mailed to St. Francis Kitchen, 500 Penn Ave., Scranton, PA 18509.
shorts.content: The Keystone Chapter UNICO donated and volunteered at St. Francis of Assisi Kitchen in Scranton for their April Service Day. After instructions and prepping for the dinner, they had the opportunity to serve the clients of St. Francis Kitchen. Keystone UNICO volunteers pictured with St. Francis Kitchen’s executive chef, Selena Gonzalez, are Tina Haas, director; Michele McDade, president; Gonzalez; and Cathy Gerard, secretary. Kitchen donations are accepted. Checks should be made payable to and mailed to St. Francis Kitchen, 500 Penn Ave., Scranton, PA 18509.
shorts.content_distilled: Keystone Chapter UNICO donated and volunteered at St.

shorts.title: HS FOOTBALL: North Pocono stays at No. 1; Valley View makes big leap in Week 2 poll
shorts.title_distilled: HS FOOTBALL: North Pocono stays at No.
shorts.description: North Pocono started the season with a statement, and Valley View made the loudest noise in Week 1 of the high school football season. The Trojans walloped Nanticoke Area, winning 56-0, and remained the No. 1 team in The Times-Tribune poll of the top 10 teams. Valley View, which earned a hard-fought win in a clash with Scranton Prep, climbed five places from No. 9 in the preseason to No. 4 this week. Both teams hit the road this weekend to play Wyoming Valley Conference opponents. North Pocono plays at Pittston Area (1-0), which started with a convincing win over […]
shorts.content: North Pocono started the season with a statement, and Valley View made the loudest noise in Week 1 of the high school football season. The Trojans walloped Nanticoke Area, winning 56-0, and remained the No. 1 team in The Times-Tribune poll of the top 10 teams. Valley View, which earned a hard-fought win in a clash with Scranton Prep, climbed five places from No. 9 in the preseason to No. 4 this week. Both teams hit the road this weekend to play Wyoming Valley Conference opponents. North Pocono plays at Pittston Area (1-0), which started with a convincing win over […]
